title: Skubal gets repeat Cy Young; Skenes unanimous
content: Tigers ace Tarik Skubal became the first back-to-back Cy Young Award winner since Jacob deGrom (2018-19), while the Pirates' Paul Skenes won his first in the NL.

title: WR Brown vents about offense, not sorry for stir
content: Hours after video surfaced of him saying things are "a s---show" outside of his family life, an unapologetic A.J. Brown said his discontent is with Philadelphia's offense as a whole, not his own situation.

title: Kidd urges outraged Mavs fans to 'move forward'
content: Mavericks head coach Jason Kidd urged fans to "move forward" after the firing of GM Nico Harrison and stressed that his players are playing hard and "trying to win."

title: LeBron (sciatica) practices with G-League team
content: LeBron James took a key step toward returning to the Lakers when he practiced with the team's G League affiliate on Wednesday.

title: MSU hit with 3-year probation, 14 wins vacated
content: Due to NCAA violations, Michigan State football was placed on a three-year probation Wednesday, a school spokesperson confirmed.

title: St. Brown apologizes if 'Trump dance' offended
content: Lions wide receiver Amon-Ra St. Brown apologized on his podcast if he "offended anyone" with his "Trump dance" touchdown celebration Sunday while President Donald Trump was in attendance.

title: Former Cleveland State coach Mackey dies at 80
content: Kevin Mackey, the first Division I men's basketball coach to win an NCAA tournament game with a so-called "Cinderella" team, died Tuesday from an apparent heart attack, his son, Brian, told ESPN. Mackey was 80.

title: McDaniel 'indebted' to Quinn over sobriety fight
content: Mike McDaniel said he is "forever indebted" to Dan Quinn because the Commanders coach helped steer him toward sobriety.

title: MLB Awards Week predictions, results: Skenes, Skubal earn Cy Young Awards
content: Baseball's best are collecting their hardware this week. On Wednesday, it was a pair of aces from Pittsburgh and Detroit.

title: Chewed out by Saban, brushed off by DeBoer, Ty Simpson persevered to lead the Tide
content: After a long wait and a rough start, the Crimson Tide QB has his team poised for a national title bid.

title: Are the Utah Mammoth and Anaheim Ducks really this good?
content: Both clubs are in the playoff mix this season after missing in 2024-25. Can they sustain their hot starts?

title: Men's Bracketology: Houston claims No. 1 overall seed, Georgetown cracks the field
content: The Cougars top the first in-season edition of our projections. See the 67 other teams that made the cut.

title: What we’re hearing entering Week 11: Kyler Murray’s future, Giants’ next steps, flawed playoff contenders
content: Where will Murray play next season? What's next for the Giants? Which 2026 free agents are worth watching? We have the latest.

title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, plus each team's non-QB MVP at midseason
content: Updated Power Rankings ahead of Week 11. Plus, we picked every team's MVP -- not including quarterbacks.

title: The top 25 NFL free agents for 2026: Ranking players in line to get PAID this offseason
content: We listed the league's top 25 pending free agents -- including Daniel Jones and George Pickens -- and gave intel on who might return to their current team.

title: For the family of WWE legend Eddie Guerrero, his shadow still looms large
content: Twenty years after his death, the legendary WWE superstar still exists in the memories of his loved ones.

title: Better than the Babe? Mays? Bonds? How Ohtani's five-year run compares to MLB legends
content: The Dodgers' two-way star is on the verge of winning his fourth MVP award in five years. Where does his run rank among the all-time best?

title: NBA Power Rankings: Giannis dominates for Bucks, Pistons take the East
content: NBA insiders break down this week's power rankings and where all 30 teams stack up after an exciting stretch of games.

title: 'That's all it's ever been ... is doubt': Braden Smith is chasing a title -- and the NBA
content: Delivering the Boilermakers' first national championship could go a long way toward Smith's future in the NBA.

title: UWCL talking points: Chelsea impress, Arsenal left stunned
content: Beth Lindop, Alex Kirkland and Tom Hamilton answer some of our burning questions after the third round of the UEFA Women's Champions League.

title: NWSL awards: Temwa Chawinga is MVP, but silly season is upon us
content: Temwa Chawinga is the league's dominant player and will rightly be named MVP. As for the rest of the NWSL awards? That's all up for debate.

title: UFC 322 preview: Where have all the champ-champs gone?
content: Nine years ago this weekend, Conor McGregor became the first fighter to hold two UFC belts simultaneously.

title: 'Signing bonus?' Gronkowski jokes about contract at Patriots retirement ceremony
content: Pats owner Robert Kraft asked Rob Gronkowski about a two-day contract  at the ceremony, prompting a joke.

title: Facts to guide your Week 11 feelings about C.J. Stroud, Derrick Henry and more
content: Liz Loza gives you reasons to embrace the possibilities of big games from unlikely sources (and vice versa).

title: Matchup rankings: Upgrade Rico Dowdle, downgrade Baker Mayfield
content: The most and least favorable matchups for this week's NFL games at four key positions: QB, RB, WR and TE.

title: 7 storylines to follow during the boys' early signing period
content: Upcoming commitments, surprising first-year head coach starts -- and what's going on with No. 1 Tyran Stokes?

title: 2026 girls' recruiting class rankings: Top 10 entering the early signing window
content: Ahead of the early signing window, which 10 programs are already ahead with the class of 2026? Let's start with USC.

title: Luka Doncic trolled by teammates after dunk against Hornets
content: According to Basketball Reference, the dunk marked Luka Doncic's third slam in the past two seasons -- two with Los Angeles this season.

title: USC claps back after B1G said fake punt should've been penalized
content: The Big Ten said on Sunday that USC should've been penalized for the fake punt pass they executed last Friday.

title: How Premier League teams are borrowing NFL plays for set piece success
content: Set piece mania has taken over the Premier League but it seems that teams are taking plays from the NFL. Here's what they have learned.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Chelsea eye Vitor Roque
content: Several Premier League clubs are reportedly looking at a possible move for Palmeiras' Vitor Roque. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: 12 Days Before Blast, Suspects Got i20's Pollution Checked, Then Parked It
content: New angles are emerging in Monday's explosion near Red Fort, Delhi, as the investigation into the case intensifies. The explosion at 6.52 pm Monday killed nine people and injured 20 others.

title: Delhi Blast's Telegram Link: How Messaging App Became Playground For Terrorists
content: The less moderated online spaces provided by Telegram have also enabled extremists to reach wider masses and do self-promotion, brand development, and propaganda dissemination.

title: Slow-Moving Traffic, Then Big Explosion: CCTV Footage Of Delhi Red Fort Blast
content: Video footage of the bomb blast that ripped through Delhi's Red Fort surfaced today, amid an ongoing investigation into the terror attack that claimed nine lives earlier this week.

title: Bilaspur Train Accident: Probe Reveals Loco Pilot Didn't Clear Aptitude Test
content: At least eleven people were killed and 20 were injured in one of the most horrific train accidents in recent memory when the Gevra-Bilaspur MEMU passenger train rammed a stationary freight train near Lal Khadan, close to Bilaspur's Gatora station.

title: Sample Taken From Delhi Blast Site More Powerful Than Ammonium Nitrate: Sources
content: Not just ammonium nitrate, high-grade explosives were also used in the blast that occurred near the Red Fort in Delhi, an official from the Forensic Science Laboratory said.

title: Adani Cement To Deploy World's 1st 'RotoDynamic Heater' To Reduce Emissions
content: Adani Cement and Finnish company Coolbrook on Wednesday announced to deploy world's first commercial RotoDynamic Heater' to advance cement decarbonisation at the Boyareddypalli Integrated Cement Plant in Andhra Pradesh.

title: "Act Of War": Government Sources Say "Op Sindoor On" After Delhi Blast
content: In a warning to perpetrators of the Delhi terror blast, government sources reiterated that any terror operation on Indian soil will be considered an act of war.

title: PM Modi, Bhutan's Fourth King Discuss Bilateral Ties, Cultural Bonds
content: On Tuesday, Prime Minister Modi and Bhutanese King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck held extensive discussions covering a wide spectrum of cooperation, including energy, capacity building, connectivity, technology, defence, and security.

title: 'US Doesn't Have Enough Talent': Trump Defends H-1B Visa Plan After Fee Hike
content: US President Donald Trump appears to have softened his stance on his administration's aggressive immigration reforms, saying America needs to bring in foreign talent for certain fields.

title: Red Fort Blast Live Updates: Delhi Blast Suspects Recced Red Fort In January, Sources Say
content: Delhi Blast Live Updates: The anti-terror agency, NIA, has taken over the probe and begun investigations at the scene.

title: 'Rs 58 Crore, Global Links': Police Probe One Of Biggest Digital Arrests
content: The Maharashtra Cyber Department probing the Rs 58 crore digital arrest case in Mumbai has found an international network with links extending to Hong Kong, China and Indonesia, an official said on Tuesday.

title: NCP "Never Misused Power Nor Acted Arrogantly": Ajit Pawar
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar, who heads the ruling NCP, on Tuesday said people continue to repose faith in his party because of its commitment to development and welfare-oriented politics.

title: 'No Changes': Google Denies Removing Western Sahara Border For Morocco Users
content: The dotted lines illustrating the border between Western Sahara and Morocco, indicating the former's disputed territory status, have never been visible to people using Google Maps in the latter, the company told AFP on Tuesday.

title: Bill To Allow 8 Republicans To Seek Damages For Capitol Riot Probe
content: Legislation moving through Congress that would end the government shutdown in the US would also allow eight Republican senators to seek hundreds of thousands of dollars in damages for the capitol riot probe done by the Biden administration.

title: "Foreign Students Good For US": Trump's U-Turn On MAGA's Immigration Agenda
content: In a major U-turn on his immigration agenda, US President Donald Trump has advocated for allowing foreign students to study in American universities.

title: Delhi Blast Victim's Family Wanted Funeral In Hometown Meerut, Wife Refused
content: Mohsin, a resident of Uttar Pradesh's Meerut, was killed in Monday's car bomb blast near Red Fort, Delhi. An argument broke out over the place of his burial.

title: Car Used In Delhi Bomb Blast Was First Seen At Connaught Place, Mayur Vihar
content: The white Hyundai i20 car that exploded near Delhi's Red Fort, killing nine people, was first seen at Connaught Place and Mayur Vihar hours before the blast.

title: i20 Car Used In Delhi Blast Didn't Move For 12 Days, Then Doctor Panicked
content: The suspected suicide bomber, Dr Umar Nabi drove the car out of the college campus on the morning of the attack, November 10, allegedly out of panic.

title: Noel Tata's Son Neville Appointed As Trustee Of Sir Dorabji Tata Trust
content: Tata Trusts Chairman Noel Tata's son Neville was on Tuesday inducted as a trustee on the Sir Dorabji Tata Trust.

title: Samples Of 2 Different Types Of Explosives Recovered From Delhi Blast Site
content: The Forensic Science Laboratory (FSL) team investigating the car explosion near Delhi's Red Fort has recovered two live cartridges and samples of two different types of explosives on Tuesday, sources said.

title: 'Spectacular attack' foiled: DNA confirms Umar as Delhi car bomber; Ayodhya was also target
content: A major terror plot involving multiple vehicle-borne IEDs and rifle attacks has been uncovered in Delhi, with Umar Un Nabi identified as the bomber. The module, linked to a Turkiye-based handler, also targeted Ayodhya. Security agencies are actively searching for two other vehicles and pursuing all involved culprits, with the NIA taking over the investigation.

title: Codename 'Ukasa': Turkiye handler directed Delhi terror module; how bomber Umar planned strikes
content: A Turkiye-based handler, codenamed Ukasa, allegedly directed a terror module led by Al-Falah University professor Umar Un Nabi in a plot hatched in 2022. The group, linked to JeM and AGuH, planned spectacular attacks in India, including at Red Fort and Ayodhya, using vehicle-borne IEDs and explosives.

title: ‘Clearly a terror attack’: Marco Rubio praises India’s handling of Delhi blast
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio condemned the Delhi bomb blast as a "clearly a terrorist attack" and expressed solidarity with India. Following a meeting with External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar, Rubio commended India's investigation, stating authorities were "doing a great job" and reaffirmed US support for counterterrorism efforts.

title: Gujarat shocker: Wife’s 5 brothers hack off 60-yr-old’s legs in Amreli
content: A 60-year-old man, Dinesh Solanki, was brutally attacked and killed by his wife's five brothers in Amreli district while attempting to reconcile a marital dispute. Solanki's legs were severed with an axe during the violent assault at his niece's home. Police are actively searching for the accused, with the incident believed to be linked to the ongoing family conflict.

title: AI revolution: Microsoft launches world’s first 'AI superfactory'; read CEO Satya Nadella’s message
content: Microsoft has unveiled its "planet-scale AI superfactory," linking Wisconsin and Atlanta datacenters via a high-speed network. This unified complex is designed for massive AI workloads, pooling hundreds of thousands of GPUs.  The innovation aims to dynamically balance power and processing, supporting partners like OpenAI and Microsoft's own AI advancements.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Nuvama Professional Clients Group's Deputy Vice President, Aakash K Hindocha, recommends Bajaj Auto, Minda Corporation, and Union Bank of India as top buy calls. He anticipates Nifty and Bank Nifty to continue their upward trajectory.

title: Islamabad blast: Sri Lanka Cricket orders team to stay in Pakistan; PCB reschedules ODIs
content: Sri Lanka Cricket has directed its national team to continue their Pakistan tour despite security concerns following a suicide bombing, threatening players with a formal review if they leave early. Replacements will be sent if players depart against directives. The PCB has rescheduled ODI matches and enhanced security measures.

title: Ladakh airbase close to China border activated
content: India has boosted its military strength in eastern Ladakh with the operationalization of the new Nyoma airbase. This strategic move enhances troop and supply movement capabilities. Simultaneously, a large Army exercise, 'Poorvi Prachand Prahar', is underway in Arunachal Pradesh. These developments underscore India's high military readiness along the China frontier.

title: Arattai app drops out of top 100 list: Zoho founder to employees - ‘This is a particular moment’
content: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu dismissed concerns over Arattai's app ranking drop, calling it a normal business fluctuation. He emphasized Zoho's long-term 10-year strategy for messaging technology, viewing Arattai as a significant project. Vembu stated that competition is crucial to keep monopolists honest in the messaging app market.

title: 43-day logjam ends: US lawmakers vote to end record govt shutdown — key points
content: After a record 43-day shutdown, the House has passed a bill to end the government lapse, sending it to President Trump for his signature. Federal workers, stranded travellers, and food bank users faced significant hardship. The President is set to sign the measure tonight, marking a historic end to the funding crisis.

title: 'No competition': Jurel's message ahead of first South Africa Test
content: Wicketkeeper-batter Dhruv Jurel downplays rivalry with Rishabh Pant, emphasizing their shared goal of winning for India. Jurel, in strong red-ball form, is set to play in the opening Test against South Africa, with assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate confirming his inclusion. The series opener at Eden Gardens promises an exciting battle against strong pace attacks from both sides.

title: Terror module’s targets revealed: Ayodhya, India Gate, malls, railway stations
content: Gujarat and UP ATS foiled a major chemical terror plot targeting Ayodhya and Delhi, arresting three suspects including a doctor. The group planned ricin poisoning and a 26/11-style attack with IEDs and gunfire. Investigations revealed a sophisticated cross-state module with links to handlers abroad.

title: Vibe coding: Meta’s AI chief has advice for teens: Says they should spend time on..
content: Meta's AI chief, Alexandr Wang, urges teenagers to master AI tools, likening the current era to the dawn of personal computing. He advises dedicating thousands of hours to 'vibe-coding' – hands-on experimentation with AI – to gain a significant future economic advantage, much like early programmers. This rapid, iterative approach is key to understanding and maximizing AI's potential.

title: Travis Kelce opens up about meeting Tom Cruise, compares him to surprise Hollywood star
content: NFL star Travis Kelce met Hollywood icon Tom Cruise at Taylor Swift's Eras Tour, leaving him inspired by Cruise's intense focus and dedication. This encounter, alongside his new role in 'Happy Gilmore 2,' has reinforced Kelce's appreciation for discipline, teamwork, and the commitment required for elite performance, both on and off the field.

title: Hema on Dharmendra’s health: ‘Sab upar wale ke haath me hai’
content: Veteran actor Dharmendra was discharged from Breach Candy Hospital on Wednesday morning, days after being admitted for routine tests. His family and doctor confirmed that the 89-year-old will continue his recovery at home under medical supervision. Sharing her thoughts, Hema Malini admitted that the past few days have been emotionally draining.

title: CJI Gavai on 1979 rape ruling: 'Moment of institutional embarrassment'
content: Chief Justice of India BR Gavai called the Supreme Court's 1979 rape ruling a "moment of institutional embarrassment." He acknowledged the verdict, which acquitted policemen by citing the victim's "consent" due to lack of physical resistance, as a failure. This judgment, however, sparked nationwide protests, igniting the women's rights movement and leading to crucial legal reforms.

title: C.J. Stroud injury update: Texans QB’s return timeline remains uncertain
content: Houston Texans' star quarterback C.J. Stroud is still experiencing concussion symptoms and remains in NFL protocol, ruling him out for Sunday's game against the Tennessee Titans. This marks his second consecutive missed game, with backup Davis Mills preparing to start again. Head coach DeMeco Ryans confirmed Stroud, along with Tytus and Jalen, are progressing through the protocol.

title: Olympic legend Surya Bonaly robbed of medals while caring for ill mother
content: Olympic figure skater Surya Bonaly is devastated after thieves stole all her career medals while she was in Minnesota caring for her mother, who is also battling cancer. The burglary at her Las Vegas home revealed broken windows and destroyed security cameras, with surveillance footage indicating multiple individuals were involved over several days.

title: Kayla Nicole reveals truth behind Halloween costume after Swift diss rumors
content: Kayla Nicole clarified her bold Halloween costume, a recreation of Toni Braxton's iconic look, was not a jab at ex Travis Kelce or Taylor Swift. Nicole explained on her podcast that the choice was about personal expression and celebrating a cultural icon, emphasizing her commitment to uplifting other women rather than tearing them down.

title: Former NFL cheerleader defends Donald Trump after historic NFL game appearance
content: President Donald Trump attended a football game, drawing mixed reactions from the crowd. This event marked a historic moment, with a sitting president attending an NFL regular-season game for the first time in decades. A former cheerleader defended Trump, criticizing the political climate. The incident reignited discussions about sports and politics in America.

title: Delhi blast: Doctor-cop unmasks terror web of moulvi, medics, modules
content: Srinagar SSP Dr. GV Sundeep Chakravarthy cracked a sophisticated Jaish-e-Mohammed network of radicalized doctors. The investigation, initiated by posters, uncovered cross-state links and led to the arrest of medical professionals involved in terror activities. This intricate probe highlights the SSP's dedication to counter-terrorism.

title: Yoga, workout & a double century: How Kohli inspired 1983 WC winner to hit the gym
content: Virat Kohli's dedication to fitness profoundly impacted former cricketer Sandeep Patil. Patil witnessed Kohli's rigorous routine, including early morning yoga and post-match gym sessions, even on a match day in 2016. Inspired by Kohli's encouragement, Patil, then 60, began his own fitness journey.

title: Laughs & hopes stolen: A family dinner, a b'day — stories of lives shattered near Red Fort
content: A devastating blast near Delhi's Red Fort shattered multiple lives, turning routine journeys into final goodbyes. Families are left grappling with immeasurable loss as breadwinners, on quick errands or planned reunions, perished in the tragedy, leaving behind shattered dreams and uncertain futures.

title: 'Using Epstein hoax to distract from shutdown': Trump slams Democrats; warns Republicans of 'trap'
content: President Trump has labelled claims linking him to Jeffrey Epstein's alleged crimes a "hoax," accusing Democrats of using the issue to distract from their own political failures and the ongoing government shutdown.  Emails released by House Democrats have raised questions about Trump's past interactions with Epstein, though the White House dismisses them as a manufactured narrative.

title: Delhi blast caught on cam: New video emerges of exact moment when car exploded - watch
content: A devastating car explosion near Delhi's Red Fort, captured on CCTV, has been declared a terrorist incident by the government. The blast killed twelve and injured many, with preliminary findings revealing severe internal injuries. The NIA is investigating a suspected Jaish-e-Mohammad module, collecting DNA samples from the alleged driver's mother.

title: Govt okays Rs 25k crore export mission and extra credit for traders hit by tariffs
content: The Union Cabinet has approved a Rs 25,060 crore Export Promotion Mission and Rs 20,000 crore in additional collateral-free credit to support exporters facing global trade uncertainty. This six-year mission aims to improve access to credit, address logistics costs, and facilitate market access for labor-intensive sectors like textiles and leather.

title: Supreme Court flags illegal mining, reserves verdict on single definition of Aravalis
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday expressed concern over rampant illegal mining in the Aravali range, highlighting its immense damage to the sensitive ecosystem. While reserving verdict on a uniform definition, the court acknowledged the need for sustainable use, with a committee suggesting stringent guidelines for regulated mining alongside conservation efforts.

title: At 0.3%, retail inflation hits record low in October
content: Retail inflation hit a record low of 0.3% in October, driven by GST rate cuts and a sharp decline in food prices. This significant drop, the lowest in the current CPI series, has fueled expectations of an interest rate cut by the RBI in December.

title: From Umar to Muzammil: Who are the six docs behind Red Fort blast; all you need to know
content: A trans-state white-collar terror module involving doctors, clerics, and professionals, linked to Jaish-e-Mohammed and Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind, was unearthed after a high-intensity explosion near Delhi's Red Fort. Joint operations led to the arrest of seven suspects and the recovery of over 2,900 kg of explosives and firearms.

title: Police reveal shocking update in Michael Duarte’s death as influencer’s family faces heartbreak
content: Popular food influencer Michael Duarte, known as FoodWithBearHands, was fatally shot by police in Texas during a disturbance call involving a knife. Duarte, who amassed millions of followers for his cooking videos and charitable aspirations, was pronounced dead at a hospital. His family is seeking support to bring him home and cover funeral expenses.

title: Time to show transparency, says SC on courts reserving verdicts
content: Seven High Courts faced criticism for failing to provide Supreme Court with data on reserved verdicts. The apex court had ordered this information following delays in judgment pronouncements. Justices Kant and Bagchi emphasized transparency, directing the High Courts to submit the compiled data within two weeks or face personal appearance.

title: Wife's love for stray dogs caused stress, led to erectile dysfunction, man tells HC, seeks divorce
content: A man has approached the Gujarat high court seeking a divorce, citing cruelty by his wife who allegedly brought stray dogs into their home, causing public humiliation and distress. The court is reviewing his appeal after a family court dismissed his divorce petition, deeming the wife's actions, including a prank call about an affair, insufficient grounds for divorce.

title: Pakistan, terror groups out to disrupt progress in J&K: LG Manoj Sinha
content: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha stated that terrorism has been the primary adversary of the region's youth, aiming to disrupt their progress. He urged vigilance against disruptive elements and emphasized protecting the youth's dreams. Former CM Mehbooba Mufti called for strict action against those involved in the terror module but urged fair treatment for their relatives.

title: Early warning signs of vitamin B12 deficiency can appear in your toes
content: Early signs of vitamin B12 deficiency often manifest in the toes, with tingling, numbness, or a burning sensation indicating nerve damage. These symptoms, frequently overlooked, can lead to irreversible complications if not addressed. Recognizing these subtle indicators is crucial for timely diagnosis and treatment to protect overall nervous system health.

title: Scott Bessent doubles down on Trump's H-1B remarks: 'Train US workers, then go home'
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent outlined President Trump's H-1B visa strategy, emphasizing temporary skilled worker programs for knowledge transfer to train American workers. This approach aims to rebuild the nation's industrial base and fill critical talent gaps in sectors like manufacturing and defense, rather than replacing domestic jobs.

title: After US tariff hike, Andhra Pradesh cuts power bill to help shrimp farmers
content: In a bold initiative, Andhra Pradesh is revitalizing its shrimp farming sector by slashing electricity tariffs for farmers. This strategic decision seeks to enhance competitiveness against international players such as Ecuador. Minister Nara Lokesh showcased this impressive cut, while also emphasizing the state's commitment to uncovering new export avenues.

title: Bomb hoaxes keep security personnel at airports on toes
content: Following a recent blast, airports in Delhi and Mumbai, along with three others, received a bomb threat, triggering extensive security searches. The message, received by IndiGo, warned of attacks within 24 hours. While security was already heightened, it was further intensified. After hours of thorough checks, the threat was ultimately deemed a hoax.

title: Cabinet revises royalty for four critical minerals to boost mining
content: India's cabinet has approved increased royalty rates for graphite, zirconium, caesium, and rubidium to boost domestic mining and production. This move aims to enhance energy and supply chain security amidst a global scramble for critical minerals. The new ad valorem royalty structure, particularly for graphite, is expected to unlock significant mineral resources, including associated critical minerals like lithium.

title: India sees 21% dip in TB cases but has 25% of new patients globally
content: India has achieved a remarkable 21% drop in TB cases, yet still represents a quarter of global infections.  Intensified national efforts have significantly boosted diagnosis and treatment coverage, with success rates now exceeding the global average.  This progress, despite the persistent challenge, highlights India's commitment to eradicating the disease.

title: Selena Gomez steps up in Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce’s life amid Blake rift
content: Taylor Swift is reportedly leaning on Selena Gomez for wedding advice as her friendship with Blake Lively faces renewed turmoil. Lively's legal team has named Swift as a potential witness in a lawsuit, causing Swift to distance herself. This drama might even lead to Lively and Ryan Reynolds being excluded from Swift's upcoming nuptials with Travis Kelce.

title: Sensex up 595 pts, exit polls, trade talks lift hope
content: Dalal Street witnessed a significant rally on Wednesday, with Sensex and Nifty closing up by 0.7% each. Positive exit polls from Bihar and progress in US-India trade talks boosted investor sentiment. The end of the US government shutdown also contributed to the global market uplift, positively impacting Indian indices.

title: Only 3 opposition members in 31-MP JPC on 3 bills to oust ministers
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla formed a 31-member parliamentary committee to scrutinize three bills concerning the removal of PMs, CMs, and ministers under arrest for 30 days. Most opposition parties boycotted the panel, citing constitutional and federalism concerns, with only three opposition MPs joining. The bills propose disqualification upon 30 consecutive days of arrest for serious criminal charges.

title: Islamabad blast: 8 Sri Lanka cricketers return from Pak; second ODI in doubt
content: Pakistan won the first ODI by six runs at the same venue on Tuesday. Sri Lanka is also scheduled to play a triangular series with Pakistan and Zimbabwe after the ODI series. In 2009, the Sri Lankan team bus was attacked by gunmen on the way to the Gaddafi Stadium in Lahore for the second Test.

title: More power for Munir: Pak passes 27th amendment; army chief to be 1st CDF
content: Pakistan's National Assembly has passed a significant constitutional amendment. This bill grants extensive powers to the army chief, Asim Munir, and reshapes the country's judicial system. The legislation, which received overwhelming support, aims to consolidate control over key defense and judicial institutions. It establishes a new federal constitutional court and elevates the army chief's authority over all three military branches.

title: Away from the pressures of Madrid, can Vinícius find a spark playing for Brazil?
content: "he's not his father. I'm not his brother. I just want to be his coach," ancelotti says . the former coach says he wants to be the coach of the national team . he says his personal life is his own and is not to everyone's liking .

title: Reranking all 68 Power 4 QBs: Who rose and who fell after two months
content: a new app lets you watch your favorite events in the newly enhanced ESPN App . the new app will help you figure out who the best quarterbacks will be in a given season . it's a good idea of this year's hierarchy with just three regular-season Saturdays to go .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in? Who's out? Who's close after the second ranking?
content: a big winner might have been the entire state of Texas . the no. 3 Aggies are still in a first-round bye position . no. 15 Miami regained its position as the committee's top ACC team .

title: Passan's perfect move for 21 MLB teams that could go big this offseason
content: a deluge of moves is coming between now and the new year . there are caveats: at least one team on this list will sign multiple players . some players who could be on here are a stretch because of budgets .

title: CFP rankings release: See the second top 25 and bracket
content: the college football playoff committee will release its rankings each Tuesday through the end of the regular season . the final set of rankings will be released on Dec. 7 and those rankings will determine the final 12-team bracket . based on the CFP top 25 .

title: 🏈 Bottom 10: BYU makes dreaded appearance!
content: the red Raiders take over deep in BYU territory after a muffed punt by Parker Kingston . "It's Getting Real in the Whole Foods parking lot," DJ Spider Here at Bottom 10 Headquarters . the calendar hangs on the front of our refrigerator .

title: Logo threes to golf tees: Caitlin Clark's Annika Pro-Am highlights
content: the 2024 WNBA Rookie of the Year competed last year alongside Nelly Korda and played the back nine holes . this wasn't Clark's first experience at the Annika pro-am . here were the best moments from Clark at the event .

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: the blackout affects ABC, the ESPN networks, the Disney-branded channels, Freeform, the FX networks and the Xfinity network . the conflict affects the channel's ability to carry Disney programming . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services including Cox, Dish, DirecTV, Fios, Fubo, Hulu + Live TV, Mediacom, Optimum, Sling, Spectrum TV and

title: Women's college basketball Power Rankings: The 16 best teams so far
content: the first edition of ESPN's women's college basketball Power Rankings for 2025-26 . the top four teams in our initial rankings are the programs that went to the Final Four last season . of that group, UCLA has the most impressive victory so far: 73-59 over fellow top-10 team Oklahoma on Monday .

title: Net-zero goal: NTPC scouting for nuclear plant land in 16 states; to cut fossil fuel reliance
content: state-run NTPC is scouting for land in 16 states for setting up nuclear power plants . the move comes ahead of a govt plan to amend the Atomic Energy Act and Civil Liability for Nuclear Damage Act of 2010 to facilitate entry of foreign players and technology partners .

title: 'Money dispute between docs': Delhi blast suspects planned serial strikes in 4 cities — new details emerge
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." Read More

title: Can lawyers break client confidentiality? | Explained
content: Is the counsel between a lawyer and client a privileged communication? Which are the three circumstances in which a lawyer can communicate what his client has said? Why is safeguarding this evidentiary privilege important? Is a lawyer a constitutional actor?

title: Man-eater leopard should be shot at sight, says Maharashtra Forest Minister
content: Ganesh Naik also argued that if the leopards are not sterilised, then these animals will roam like dogs in the residential area.

title: Severe respiratory and cardiac cases push treatment costs up 11%: Report
content: The other key findings showed that children are the hardest hit, making up nearly half of all pollution-linked insurance claims with the claims escalating 14 % post-Deepavali

title: How Albert Theatre became Madras’ cultural landmark
content: Consisting of big-screen Albert and the smaller Baby Albert, the venue became a matter of pride for those living in Egmore, and they referred it to as namma (our) theatre

title: Professors deliberate on formative exams as a form of assessment
content: The academia seems to be inclined towards adopting formative methods of assessment, involving continuous, low-stakes techniques, to ensure better learning outcomes.

title: Congress, seven parties decide to form anti-BJP front in Assam
content: The objective is to defeat the Bharatiya Janata Party in the 2026 Assembly elections, Congress leaders said

title: Chromium above permissible limit in 95% people in Kanpur Nagar; NGT directs U.P. government to map affected people
content: The NGT said that Amicus Curiae in the case, advocate Katyayni, has informed the court that initially the issue was confined to the Kanpur Nagar, Kanpur Dehat and Fatehpur, but the affected area is increasing

title: Petition seeks ban on biopic for ‘incorrect portrayal’ of Kamaraj
content: Hari Nadar of Shathriya Sandror Padai has filed the PIL plea claiming that the movie may lead to caste clashes between Nadars and Thevars

title: Ministry of External Affairs rolls out ‘upgraded version’ of Passport Seva Programme
content: The MEA describes the introduction of e-passports alongside PSP V2.0 a ‘significant milestone for the Ministry’

title: Excess rains in Mumbai linked to 8% deaths in monsoon months
content: The monsoon months of June-September frequently register days of extremely heavy rainfall made worse, as scientists say, by human-caused climate change.

title: Driver, doctor accused in blast case visited Red Fort in January
content: One of them visited Turkiye a few years ago, officials suspect that during the visit, accused doctor met one of his handlers from the Jaish-e-Mohammed; Faridabad police recover a red Ford EcoSport car linked to accused from a village in Haryana

title: Youth skills vital for India’s future, says Lokesh
content: Only 34.7% of the workforce in India has formal skill training; there is an urgent need for skill-oriented education, says the Minister at the CII–VIT Andhra Pradesh Higher Education Conclave 2025

title: Centre to amend and reform Plant Variety Act: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
content: A group of scientists had recently written to the Union Agriculture Minister, demanding the government’s intervention to protect India’s sovereign rights over its vast genetic wealth

title: Delhi car blast: Doctor axed by J&K LG Manoj Sinha for terror ties was recruited by Al-Falah
content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‘prime’ political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. Her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife, besides probing strategic affairs in India’s neighbourhood. Read More

title: Over 40 lakh people screened for cancers under Gruha Arogya scheme
content: Between August to October, 16,277 suspected cases were referred for further investigation. Of these, there were 552 confirmed diagnoses

title: BJP appoints four new general secretaries to Mumbai unit
content: This is seen as the party’s effort to reach out to several communities in Mumbai, essential for civic body elections

title: Over 30 lakh deceased voters likely to be removed from West Bengal electoral rolls based on Aadhaar data
content: As of 4 p.m. on Wednesday, 6.87 crores (89.67%) of enumeration forms had been distributed across West Bengal.

title: Ukraine war a ‘living lab’, India adapting lessons for future conflicts: Army chief
content: The Army is moving towards Industry 5.0, a shift from automation-driven systems to human-centric technology, said General Dwivedi

title: ED seizes ₹21.71-crore assets linked to accused in $20-million crypto fraud case
content: The ED investigation revealed that the trusted websites were spoofed in such a way by search engine optimisation that when the website would be searched, the spoofed one would appear at the top

title: Vigilant civic society partnered with courts to drive progress in gender justice: CJI
content: ‘Collective voice of citizens has ensured that regressive precedents were questioned, debated, and ultimately corrected through reform or legislative intervention’

title: Delhi blast: Al-Falah University distances itself from accused doctors; police raids on campus, nearby villages
content: University Vice-Chancellor expresses concern over allegations made by ‘online platforms’ about laboratories being used for storing explosives materials; the police conduct door-to-door searches in Fatehpur Taga for explosives and suspects

title: NIA conducts searches across five States in Al-Qaeda Gujarat terror conspiracy case
content: The searches were carried out on premises linked to various suspects and their associates in West Bengal, Tripura, Meghalaya, Haryana, and Gujarat. Several digital devices and  documents were seized

title: Supreme Court to examine if farmers are evading satellite surveillance
content: Amicus curiae claims that agriculturists burn crop residue after surveillance satellite passes; court seeks latest report on stubble burning from Punjab and  Haryana

title: India, Botswana announce cheetah translocation pact; President Murmu says ‘will take good care of them’
content: The two heads of State will preside over an event where five of the eight captured cheetahs will be released into a quarantine facility at Mokolodi nature reserve, marking the symbolic handing over of the hunting cats to India by Botswana as part of ‘Project Cheetah’ and under a mutual initiative for wildlife conservation

title: Child safety: Seven departments in Karnataka issue joint circular
content: With an aim to curb teen pregnancies, child abuse, and child marriages, seven departments have issued a joint circular asking authorities concerned to initiate a slew of measures

title: Trinamool accuses EC of issuing orders favouring BJP during SIR in Bengal
content: Party claims BJP benefits from ECI notice allowing appointment of BLAs from different polling booths within same Assembly constituency; BJP raises concerns about political affiliations of BLOs

title: Enumeration forms distributed to 73% voters in Phase 2 of SIR, says Election Commission
content: Lakshadweep has topped the list covering all but one voter — 57,812 of 57,813 voters or nearly 100%; Goa is a close second having covered 99.99%; Kerala is lagging behind other States with only 49.55% coverage; West Bengal and Tamil Nadu, which witnessed protests against the SIR, have covered 88.8% and 78.09% voters respectively

title: Over 600 detained across Kashmir; Jamaat-e-Islami premises searched
content: The crackdown on suspects in Kashmir was stepped up after the Red Fort blast, which left 13 civilians dead.

title: Death toll in Bilaspur train tragedy hits 12
content: An initial probe conducted by the Railways reportedly found that the crew of the MEMU passenger train failed to control it at the red signal

title: IISc study finds that anthropogenic changes threaten survival of Eastern Himalayan birds
content: The team tagged birds with lightweight aluminium rings and revisited the same sites annually to track their survival and changes in body mass

title: Five years on, Hosakerehalli flyover to open by weekend, trials begin
content: The 400-metre project, which began in August 2020 at a cost of ₹30 crore, and is often dubbed the ‘brother’ of the Ejipura Flyover, was originally scheduled for completion in 2022

title: Keep tabs on guests, install CCTV cameras, Hyderabad police tell owners of hotels and lodges
content: Verification of guest identities, maintenance of visitor records and installation of CCTV cameras were among the key points discussed

title: Terrorism destroyed aspirations of youth in past three decades: J&K L-G
content: These remarks came after the role of three doctors from Kashmir came under the scanner for “terror links” in the recent past

title: State govt. staff assaulted by four men in Yadgir
content: The victim has been identified as Anjali Girish Kambanoor, a Second Division Assistant working in the Social Welfare Department

title: Tuberculosis incidence falling in India by 21% a year: WHO report
content: India’s TB mortality rate has decreased from 28 per lakh population in 2015 to 21 per lakh population in 2024, reflecting significant progress in reducing deaths due to TB

title: Bombay High Court criticises govt. over malnutrition deaths in Maharashtra’s tribal regions
content: The Bench comprising Justices Revati Mohite Dere and Sandesh Patil was hearing a series of petitions filed over the infant deaths due to malnourishment in Amravati district’s Melghat region, a tribal-dominant area, where chronic malnutrition has existed for years

title: BDA allots alternate sites to 784 Arkavathy Layout allottees in NPKL
content: Allottees have been running from pillar to post to get possession of their sites after paying up thier full amount; many have been waging decade-long legal battles and paying property tax for sites they didn’t have for two decades

title: Congress to prepare chargesheets against LDF-ruled local bodies
content: A Congress insider says the BJP poses a more persistent and immediate threat to UDF’s electoral prospects. “Heavy loss of anti-incumbency votes to the BJP would possibly cost the Congress more than the LDF”, he stated.

title: GI tag fee cut to ₹1,000; Minister promises backing for tribal goods
content: Commerce minister assures full support in setting up export links, international warehouses for tribal enterprises, their products

title: Rift in BJP over candidate selection in Palakkad
content: The BJP State leadership has not approved the district committee’s candidate list for the municipality as it has left out the current municipal chairperson, vice-chairman

title: Gujarat ATS raids Hyderabad doctor’s residence in ‘terror conspiracy’ probe
content: The searches, conducted at his house in Fort View Colony, Upparpally, are a part of the ongoing probe into the plot to develop ricin, a lethal toxin derived from castor beans

title: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu presents new clothes to housing beneficiaries
content: Naidu participates in house-warming ceremonies of a few of them at Devgudipalle in Annamayya district

title: CISF foils smuggling attempt, seizes ₹1.4 crore worth of electronic goods at Hyderabad airport
content: Seized items include 65 Iphone 17 Pro Max, eightDrone DJI Air 3, four Video Game (Nintendo Switch 2), two laptops, 20 Apple watches and a Google Pixel watch

title: Scuffle between two inmates at Chanchalguda Central Prison
content: The two were reportedly acquainted from earlier periods of incarceration, and the clash is believed to have stemmed from an old enmity

title: Sugarcane farmers continue to stage protest in Mudhol, other places
content: Some factories start crushing for the season even as an attempt led by Minister Thimmapur to negotiate with the protesting growers fails
